description: The Data Mapper enables you to configure data mappings.

actions.description: The action renames keys of an input object defined by mappings.

actions.description: Replaces a given value with the specified value defined in mappings. In case there is no mapping specified for the value, it returns the default value, and if there is no default defined, it returns null. You can also change a string value with regex.

actions.title: Replace all specified values

actions.description: Replaces all values specified by the keys in the input object with the values specified by keys in the output object.
actions.name: replaceMultipleValuesByKey

properties.description: An object containing one or more properties.
properties.name: input
properties.label: Input

properties.description: An object containing one or more properties.
properties.name: output
properties.label: Output

properties.description: Object that contains properties 'from' and 'to'.
properties.name: mappings
properties.label: Mappings

properties.description: Defines the input path of property key of the value you want to change. Dot notation.
properties.name: from
properties.label: From Path

properties.description: Defines the output path of property key of the value you want to change the input value to. Dot notation.
properties.name: to
properties.label: To Path

actions.title: Replace multiple values by key

actions.description: Creates a new object with the chosen input properties. You can also rename the property keys.
actions.name: mapObjectsToObject

properties.description: The input type.
properties.name: inputType
properties.label: Input type

properties.description: An object containing one or more properties.
properties.name: input
properties.label: Input

properties.description: An array containing one or more objects.
properties.name: input
properties.label: Input

properties.description: An array of objects that contains properties 'from', 'to' and 'requiredField'. For nested keys, it supports dot notation, where the new mapped path can be used for nested mapping.
properties.name: mappings
properties.label: Mapping

properties.description: Path to the input property key that you want to put in the newly created object, written in dot notation.
properties.name: from
properties.label: Path From

properties.description: Name of the key you want to assign to the input property value in the newly created object.
properties.name: to
properties.label: To

properties.description: Does the property require a value?
properties.name: requiredField
properties.label: Required field

properties.description: Should fields from the original object that do not have mappings be included in the new object?
properties.name: includeUnmapped
properties.label: Include Unmapped

properties.description: Should fields that have null values be included in the new object?
properties.name: includeNulls
properties.label: Include Nulls

properties.description: Should fields with empty string values be included in the new object?
properties.name: includeEmptyStrings
properties.label: Include Empty strings

actions.title: Map objects to object

actions.description: Transform an object or array of objects into an array of key-value pairs.
actions.name: mapObjectsToArray

properties.description: Type of the input. Cam be an object or an array of objects.
properties.name: inputType
properties.label: Input type

properties.description: An input object containing one or more properties.
properties.name: input
properties.label: Input

properties.description: An input array containing one or more objects.
properties.name: input
properties.label: Input

properties.description: Property key of each newly created object in the array. Its property value will be a property key from the input.
properties.name: fieldKey
properties.label: Field key

properties.description: Property key of each newly created object in the array. Its property value will be a property value from the input.
properties.name: valueKey
properties.label: Value key

actions.title: Map objects to array

actions.description: Creates a new object out of all objects that have the same key as the specified field kay and an object as value. That value of the new object contains values of all properties that share the specified field key as keys and the they all have the specified field value as a value.
actions.name: mergeAndPivotPropertiesByKey

properties.description: An array that contains objects with key-value properties that need do be merged.
properties.name: input
properties.label: Input

properties.description: The key of the newly created object.
properties.name: fieldKey
properties.label: Field Key

properties.description: The value of each property in the newly created objects value.
properties.name: fieldValue
properties.label: Field Value

actions.title: Merge and pivot properties by key
